objective.answer: The primary objective of the paper is to develop C2Ideas, an innovative system for designers to creatively ideate color schemes enabled by an intent-aligned and domain-oriented large language model, addressing the challenges of aligning AI-generated designs with user intentions and design rationales.
objective.evidence: Informed by a need-finding preliminary study, we develop C2Ideas, an innovative system for designers to creatively ideate color schemes enabled by an intent-aligned and domain-oriented large language model.

knowledge_gap.answer: Existing AI-based approaches for color design often misalign with user intention and disregard design rationales, lacking a comprehensive integration of domain knowledge such as color psychology and composition principles.
knowledge_gap.evidence: Nevertheless, existing AI-based approaches for color design have been focusing on utilizing pre-trained models learned from large datasets, whilst few efforts are devoted to understanding such abstract requirements.

answer: C2Ideas integrates a three-stage process that aligns with the conventional workflow of interior color design, enhancing interpretability and controllability.
The system incorporates domain knowledge through prompt engineering and employs a multi-tiered feedback mechanism to align with diverse user intents.
C2Ideas provides an interactive interface for user refinement, enabling a semi-automated method for converting user intent into scene-specific color schemes.
evidence: C2Ideas integrates a three-stage process: Idea Prompting stage distills user intentions into color linguistic prompts; Word-Color Association stage transforms the prompts into semantically and stylistically coherent color schemes; and Interior Coloring stage assigns colors to interior elements complying with design principles.

We introduce an LLM-based system workflow for interior color design, which incorporates domain knowledge through prompt engineering and effectively aligns with diverse user intents by employing a multi-tiered feedback mechanism.
We develop a semi-automated approach C2Ideas, that converts user intent into scene-specific color schemes bolstered by an interactive interface for user refinement.

inspirational_papers.evidence: Numerous efforts have been made to intertwine AI and color design, encompassing approaches that range from data-driven models learning textual-color mappings [8, 60] to prompt-driven strategies guiding pre-trained models towards user-desired outcomes [9].

steps.output: Domain-oriented prompts composed of professional design themes and color mood attributes
steps.evidence: In the first stage, we aim to translate user intentions into a set of well-defined prompts, which are then used to guide the subsequent process.
In the second stage, we aim to transfer conceptual color prompts to definitive color schemes, keeping semantic and stylistic coherence.

steps.input: Color scheme and textual description of the interior scene
steps.evidence: In the third stage, we color the interior scene using the generated color scheme, test how well the scheme fits the interior space and refine the result if necessary.
